newsitem.title: USA: US Feb construction spending highest since Mar '96.
newsitem.headline: US Feb construction spending highest since Mar '96.

text.p: Construction spending shot ahead at the fastest rate in nearly a year in February, the Commerce Department said on Tuesday, as warm weather fostered big gains in both private and publicly financed projects.

Spending jumped 2.3 percent to a record seasonally adjusted annual rate of $603.8 billion after a revised 0.3 percent January rise, when bitter weather slowed building activity. It far exceeded Wall Street economists' forecasts of a smaller 0.9 percent increase in February spending.

Department officials said February posted the strongest rise in monthly spending since a matching 2.3 percent rise in March last year. The last time there was a bigger spending jump was nearly three years ago, in March 1994, when it gained by 3.4 percent.
February construction spending was running nearly 11 percent above the February 1996 rate of $544.6 billion a year.
The government previously reported that January construction spending had risen by 0.4 percent, but it revised that down slightly.
